data.title: Great Food.
data.text: The Acai Bowls are delicious as is the rest of the food. A great place to stop! Highly recommend for Breakfast and Lunch or even an early dinner.

data.title: Huh......
data.text: Went to Swami's with my mom and sister. I ordered the grilled cheese sandwich, and this is what came out.  Maybe I should have asked for the piece of bread to be covered in cheese.....didn't think I needed to be that specific.

data.title: CA surf lunch
data.text: We like this place. Its a real CA surf place for lunch. The food is good and you have a nice lunch in outdoor.

data.title: Healthy choice
data.text: Funky looking roadside café with the best Acai bowls on Earth. Excellent fresh food. Albacore sandwich is outstanding. Host John is very entertaining. Great for breakfast and lunch.

data.title: Varied, delicious menu!
data.text: Veggie sandwich for breakfast - why not?  The Acai bowl was terrific too; just be prepared for some of the fruit to still be frozen. Excellent coffee and overall reasonable prices too. We'll be back!

data.title: a bit over-hyped but decent enough.
data.text: for so many stellar reviews, maybe i was expecting a bit more, but pretty good place overall.  we had the shrimp tropical wrap and it was quite tasty.  its rather large, so plan on sharing it.

data.title: Unique, fun, hip dining
data.text: Stopped here on our coastal drive. Service was fun and quick. The mex  mocha iced drink was delicious. Great coffee drinks and the food was interesting and delicious. Check this place out!

data.title: Good stuff for the patient
data.text: Left after 20 min waiting for a cappuccino, friendly atmosphere but not high service standard, the bowls are great if they dont forget your order...

data.title: Delicious food.  Casual patio dining.  Hippie vibe.
data.text: This place is right on Hwy 101 as you travel through Encinitas.  It has counter ordering and very casual, open -seating, patio dining.  There was a bit of a line but the staff was friendly.  There is writing all over the walls and ceiling and surf murals too.  There is a coffee bar with about 10 choices in self-serve carafes.  Food is reasonably priced.  Kids pancakes were shaped like Mickey Mouse with fruit for features.  French toast was off the chain.  If you have a big appetite, John's wrap with pieces of warm chicken, bacon, avocado, bacon and lettuce with a side of chips and salsa is a flavorful, filling choice.  Lots of variety on the menu including many delicious smoothies and vegetarian options.  To try for next visit is the acai smoothie bowl with fresh berries and granola.  About 6 other people ordered that and it looked amazing.  We were there about 11 and the sun hits the patio just right-a great place to linger and visit.

data.title: Great place
data.text: Swami's is a small convoluted space that serves great food. You stand in line to order and they bring it to your table. They serve breakfast and lunch.  Breakfast items are omelettes, Burritos, and great smoothies and fruit items.  Coffee is self serve.  A great place to eat and hang out. Prices are really reasonable.

data.title: Mayo on Breakfast Croissant--Ugh!
data.text: The mayonaisse on the breakfast croissant ruined it.  The only thing we enjoyed was the fresh juice.  The cappucino tasted "off."  Maybe the machine needed cleaning?  This is a little place on the side of the road.  You have to get your own menus then place your order at the window.  That would have been OK if the food was good.  The rest room had no toilet paper.

data.title: Yummy and close to the beach!
data.text:
I love Swami's, and this location has been opened just six months.  It's just two blocks from the beach, three blocks from the pier, and close to lodging and the movie theater.  The food is great, from American to Mexican, all-day breakfast and very healthy eats.  My husband ordered eggs benedict (options of mock bacon, spinach, avocado, or bacon) with homefry potatoes, and I order an Acai bowl with fresh fruit (banana, strawberries, blueberries, coconut, granola, bee pollen, and frozen acai).  The servings are huge!

You order at the counter from an extensive menu, and then they bring the food and drinks (I had Mexican Mocha) to you.  Casual but hip!

data.title: Great Breakfast/Brunch/Lunch Spot
data.text: Our family of 4 ended up here 3 different times during our weeklong visit to Solana Beach.  We wanted to try smoothie bowls and heard this was a great place to get it.  Each time we came I think a minimum of 2 smoothie bowls were ordered and they were huge and very tasty.  We also had pancakes, breakfast burritos, sandwiches and burgers.  Low key place with outdoor seating.  We felt like locals when we dined here.

owner_response.author: SwamisCafe, Owner at Swami's Cafe, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thanks for taking the time to share your kind compliments with us, Heidi! We're so pleased to hear that you and your family were able to dine with us 3 times during your trip, and enjoyed all that we had to offer. We hope you'll join us again the next time you're in town!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Swami's Cafe review
data.text: Food was good.  Very popular and so crowded in the afternoon.  Easy to park.  Good vegetarian spread.  Bit of self service.  Had to stand in line to order but line moved quickly.

data.title: What a Great Place
data.text: I ate lunch at Swami's Cafe with my adult sons and friend.  The food selection is great.  Lots of variety and healthy choices.  The food is always fresh and plentiful. You will enjoy your meal.

owner_response.author: SwamisCafe, Owner at Swami's Cafe, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thanks so much for taking the time to share your feedback with us - we're so glad that you and your friends and family enjoyed your experience at Swami's Cafe. Hope to see you back soon!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Local, convenient eats to SRF and Swami Beach
data.text: But we found it very hard to get service in the mid afternoon.  Suggest trying at lunchtime before staff are less wrapped up in decompressing.  Menu looked simple enough, but we ended up leaving as noone was interested in serving us.  No problem.  Lots of options on the main drag through town.

data.title: Acai bowls are a refreshing afternoon snack
data.text: Felt transported to the 60's courtesy of the employees, customers, music and the whole vibe. Great fun really. We had the acai bowl which was delicious and refreshing. Looks like all the food would be good.

data.title: Great local spot for breakfast or lunch
data.text: This is a great local spot for breakfast or lunch.  I prefer the outdoor patio.  It's a bit crowded but very "Encinitas"!  The staff is very friendly.  Portion sizes are large.  Everything I've had so far has been delicious.

data.title: Great tasting food. Fast, easy outdoor dining. Their brand of politics presents an....
data.text:
....interesting juxtaposition from the peaceful serenity of Swami's Retreat across the highway.  It was quite surprising to see the pro gun, open-carry welcoming signage and fundraising effort for those Bundy folks.  
That being said, the food was great. As numerous others have stated the Acai bowls are a well-deserved huge hit. Many other healthy and tasty items available.

data.title: Ah. Mazing.
data.text: Ate at Swami's twice in a week.  Beautiful, fresh, healthy salads and wraps for lunch.  The Acai bowl for breakfast is life-changing.  So fresh and good.  Loved the bee pollen and granola!  Will absolutely return on my next trip to Encinitas!
